name: bds-jira-mcp
description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for JIRA workflow automation - manages issue linking, epic hierarchies, and automates story status updates
author: Evandro Camargo

scripts.build: tsc && chmod +x build/index.js && chmod +x build/setup.js && chmod +x build/reconfigure.js
scripts.redeploy: pnpm run build && pnpm publish --registry http://localhost:4873/
scripts.publish:local: pnpm run build && pnpm run test:ci && pnpm run validate-changelog && pnpm publish --registry http://localhost:4873/
scripts.publish:npm: pnpm run build && pnpm run test:ci && pnpm run validate-changelog && pnpm publish
scripts.postinstall:
echo '
To setup bds-jira-mcp with Claude Code/Desktop, run: npx bds-jira-mcp-setup
'
scripts.claude:update-changelog: claude --print "Review changelog and check if its up-to-date, if it isn't, then ensure it is updated." --add-dir=/Users/evandrocamargo/Projects/me/jira-mcp --permission-mode=acceptEdits --allowedTools='Edit,ReadFile,Bash(git status:*),Bash(git branch:*),Bash(git log:*)'
scripts.claude:update-docs: claude --print "Review all documentation files (README.md, CLAUDE.md, and docs/ directory). Check if they are up-to-date with the current codebase and project state. If any are outdated, ensure they are updated accordingly." --add-dir=/Users/evandrocamargo/Projects/me/jira-mcp --permission-mode=acceptEdits --allowedTools='Edit,ReadFile,Bash(git status:*),Bash(git branch:*),Bash(git log:*)'
